Description: Both models identify SQL Injection and Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) as significant threats.
Both models emphasize the importance of multi-factor authentication (MFA) and role-based access control (RBAC).
Both models highlight the need for a defined incident response plan to address security incidents effectively.
Both models recognize data leakage risks, particularly through logs and misconfigurations.
Both models identify Denial of Service (DoS) attacks as a significant threat to availability.

Source: Frequent identification of SQL Injection, XSS, and DoS attacks across various threat models.
Common reliance on MFA, RBAC, and logging best practices across multiple threat models.
